Row.Text: The Dacian kingdom flourished in the Carpathian Mountains, known for its gold mines, unique falx weapons, and mountain fortresses.
Units receive +5 Combat Strength when fighting in Hills or Forest terrain. Gold Mines provide +1 Production and +1 Culture. Mountains provide +1 Influence for adjacent districts.
Newly founded cities within 6 tiles of your Capital receive a free Builder. Gain a Leader Attribute point in Military when completing a Civic tree. Temples provide +2 [ICON_Happiness] Happiness.

Hills and Forest tiles provide +1 Production when worked. Melee and Anti-Cavalry units receive a free promotion when created. Cities with town walls gain +2 Combat Strength per adjacent Hill tile. War weariness effects on Happiness reduced by 25%.

Dacian unique unit that replaces the Swordsman. Stronger than standard Swordsman with +10 Combat Strength against units with defensive promotions, but suffers -5 Defense against ranged attacks. The curved falx blade was feared by Romans for its ability to cleave shields and armor.

Dacian unique civilian unit. Provides Science and Culture when adjacent to units in combat, representing the Zalmoxian priests who observed and documented battle tactics and customs. Unlocked through the Zalmoxian Devotion civic tree.

Unique Dacian improvement that provides +2 Science, +1 Culture, +1 Happiness, and +1 Influence for each adjacent Mountain tile. Must be built on or adjacent to Hills or Mountains, representing the sacred spaces where Dacians communicated with Zalmoxis.

Towns with Fort specialization provide +10 Healing to Units (instead of +5) and +50 Health to Walls (instead of +25). They generate +1 Influence per turn and provide +5 Combat Strength to adjacent defending units. Fort Towns can be established on Hills without a population requirement.
Dacian unique civic tree focused on the belief in Zalmoxis, combining spiritual wisdom with practical knowledge.
Dacian unique civic tree focused on the noble warrior class, enhancing cavalry tactics and military benefits.
Establish formal rituals to honor Zalmoxis, the supreme deity of the Dacians.
Build sacred sites on mountain heights to commune with the divine.
Spread the belief that death is merely a transition, not an end, making warriors fearless in battle.
Establish a formal warrior class with distinct privileges and responsibilities.
Develop specialized techniques for fighting in hilly and mountainous terrain.
Create a culture that celebrates and honors military achievements.
Mountain Sanctuary buildings provide +1 additional Science.
Combat victories provide Influence equal to 20% of the defeated unit's Combat Strength.
Train Cavalry units at 15% discount. Pillaging yields +25% more resources.
Cavalry units gain +1 Movement when starting their turn on Hills.
When at war, cities generate +1 Culture per turn for each military unit stationed within their borders.
